description: Visualize k6 OSS results stored in Prometheus

links.title: Grafana k6 OSS Docs: Prometheus Remote Write
links.tooltip: Open docs in a new tab

panels.description: Select a different Stat to change the query
panels.title: Average HTTP Request Duration

panels.description: Select a different Stat to change the query HTTP-specific built-in metrics
panels.title: HTTP Latency Timings

panels.description: Filter by check name to query a particular check

targets.expr: k6_exporter_checks_passes{instance="k6_exporter:9091", job="k6_exporter", name="status was 200", path="::status was 200", server="http://k6:6565"}
k6_exporter_checks_fails{instance="k6_exporter:9091", job="k6_exporter", name="status was 200", path="::status was 200", server="http://k6:6565"}

panels.title: Checks Success Rate (aggregate individual checks)

panels.description: min/max/p95/p99 depends on the available Quantile Stats
panels.title: Requests by URL

options.content: ### Visualize other k6 results At the top of the dashboard, click `Add` and select `Visualization` from the dropdown menu. Choose the visualization type and input the PromQL queries for the `k6_` metric(s). Alternatively, click on the `Explore` icon on the menu bar and input the queries for the `k6_` metric(s). From `Explore`, you can add new Panels to this dashboard. Note that all k6 metrics are prefixed with the `k6_` namespace when sent to Prometheus.

list.description: Filter by "testid" tag. Define it by tagging: k6 run --tag testid=xyz
list.label: Test ID
list.name: testid

list.description: Statistic for Trend Metrics Queries. The available options depend on the values of the K6_PROMETHEUS_RW_TREND_STATS setting.
list.label: Trend Metrics Query
list.name: quantile_stat

list.description: Adhoc filters are applied to all panels. To enable it, go to Dashboard Settings / Variables / adhoc_filter and select the target Prometheus data source.
list.label: AdhocFilter
list.name: adhoc_filter

title: HostSpace k6 Prometheus
